page.title: 09Lovington Church
page.content: Lovington Church is one of six parish churches in the Benefice of the Six Pilgrims. Dating from around 1300 and dedicated to St.Thomas a Becket,it was restored in 1861 when the aisle was added.The heavily buttressed tower remains from the medieval church also some unique stone carving above the aumbry or cupboard where the sacred vessels were kept.In the chancel too is the original piscina which received the water used to wash the vessels for the Holy Sacrament. All six parishes in the Benefice lie on or near the road to Glastonbury that pilgrims would have taken when they visited the Abbey centuries ago. Alford,Hornblotton,Lovington,North and South Barrow and Babcary are all administered by one vicar.
